iti69:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti69:2.1: “Whoever has not given up greed, hate, and delusion
iti69:2.2: is said to have not crossed over the ocean with its waves and whirlpools, its saltwater crocodiles and monsters.
iti69:2.3: Whoever has given up greed, hate, and delusion
iti69:2.4: is said to have crossed over the ocean with its waves and whirlpools, its saltwater crocodiles and monsters. Crossed over and gone beyond, that brahmin stands on the shore.”
iti69:3.1: “Those in whom greed, hate, and ignorance
iti69:3.3: have crossed the ocean so hard to cross,
iti69:3.4: with its saltwater crocodiles and monsters, <j>its waves and dangers.
iti69:4.1: They’ve slipped their chains, given up death, and have no attachments.
iti69:4.2: They’ve given up suffering, <j>so there are no more future lives.
iti69:4.3: They’ve disappeared and cannot be defined;
iti69:4.4: they’ve confounded the King of Death, I say.”
iti69:5.1: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
